passage:
The drummer counts the alley lights under his breath.
Each lamp is a cue for the same heel turn.
Neighbors expect the pivot when his coat flares.
He keeps time by clicking the gate with his ring.
Even the stray cat sways when the ring taps.
Steam from the grates rises on beat with him.

Tonight a delivery truck idles at the curb.
The driver hums the same bar in sympathy.
Then he drops a box at the wrong beat.
Cardboard splits, spilling copper gears.
The drummer stumbles because the rhythm cracks.
design_note: Pattern is identity; the break proves the material.

passage:
Mara arranges the invoices by color before sunrise.
She sharpens three pencils until they almost vanish.
Every mug faces east on her desk.
She whispers the same greeting to the empty chairs.
The lobby clock ticks in polite approval.
Her notes align with the seams of the blotter.

A courier bursts through the door without knocking.
Rain flicks from his jacket onto the forms.
He lays a photo upside down on her keyboard.
Mara freezes as the clock skips a beat.
design_note: Pattern is identity; the break proves the material.

passage:
The chorus rehearses in the church basement.
Each vowel lengthens exactly four counts.
Sopranos lift their chins on the third bar.
Altos sway left when the organ swells.
Tenors trace the same circle on the floor with their toes.
The director smiles only when the wave repeats.

A fuse pops and the organ coughs into silence.
One tenor keeps singing a measure late.
Laughter ripples, bending the circle out of shape.
The director claps once to save the ending.
design_note: Pattern is identity; the break proves the material.
